name: reporter
moduleDoc:
Test result reporting and formatting for Probitas.

This package provides multiple reporter implementations for formatting and
displaying test execution results. All reporters implement the {@linkcode Reporter}
interface from `@probitas/runner` and can be passed to `ScenarioRunner.run()`.

## Links

- [GitHub Repository](https://github.com/jsr-probitas/probitas)
- [@probitas/probitas](https://jsr.io/@probitas/probitas) - Main package (recommended for most users)

## Related Packages

| Package | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| [@probitas/runner](https://jsr.io/@probitas/runner) | Uses reporters for output |
| [@probitas/cli](https://jsr.io/@probitas/cli) | CLI that uses these reporters |
| [@probitas/logger](https://jsr.io/@probitas/logger) | Logging used during execution |

## Available Reporters

- {@linkcode ListReporter} - Detailed hierarchical output showing scenario and step names
- {@linkcode DotReporter} - Compact single-character output (`.` for pass, `F` for fail)
- {@linkcode TapReporter} - TAP (Test Anything Protocol) format for CI integration
- {@linkcode JsonReporter} - JSON output for machine-readable results

## Base Class

- {@linkcode BaseReporter} - Abstract base class with common functionality:
  - Output stream management (defaults to stderr)
  - Serialized write operations for concurrent scenarios
  - Customizable color themes (use `noColor` option to disable)

## Theming

- {@linkcode Theme} - Interface defining semantic color functions
- {@linkcode defaultTheme} - Default colored theme
- {@linkcode noColorTheme} - Theme without ANSI color codes

## Configuration Types

- {@linkcode ReporterOptions} - Options for reporter initialization
- {@linkcode ThemeFunction} - Type for theme color functions

jsDoc.doc:
Abstract base class for all reporter implementations.

Provides common functionality that all reporters need:
- Output stream management with serialized writes
- Theme selection (colored or plain)
- Stack trace sanitization for portable output

Subclasses should override the reporter hook methods they need
(e.g., `onStepEnd`, `onScenarioEnd`, `onRunEnd`).

tags.doc: {@linkcode ListReporter} for a detailed hierarchical reporter
{@linkcode DotReporter} for a compact progress reporter

jsDoc.doc: Initialize the reporter with the given options.

tags.name: options
tags.doc: - Configuration options for output and styling

jsDoc.doc:
Write text to the output stream.

Serializes all write operations to prevent "stream is already locked" errors
when multiple scenarios run concurrently. Each write is queued and executed
in order.

tags.name: text
tags.doc: - Text to write (will be UTF-8 encoded)

jsDoc.doc:
Sanitize file paths in error stack traces to make them environment-independent

Replaces absolute file:// URLs with relative paths to ensure snapshots
are portable across different machines and CI environments.

tags.doc: Sanitized stack trace with normalized paths

jsDoc.doc: TAP Reporter - outputs Test Anything Protocol version 14 format
Called when test run starts - outputs TAP header and test count
Called when step completes - output TAP result
Called when scenario is skipped - output SKIP directive for all steps

tags.name: _duration
tags.doc: Scenario execution duration (not used in TAP format)

jsDoc.doc: Called when test run completes - reset state
List Reporter - outputs results in flat list format
Called when step completes - output result line
Called when step fails - output error details
Called when run ends - output summary
JSON Reporter - outputs results in JSONLine format
Dot Reporter - outputs simple dot format progress
Called when scenario completes - output dot
Called when test run completes - output summary

Function type for theme color/styling transformations.

Takes a string and returns a styled version (typically with ANSI codes).

Theme interface for semantic output styling.

Provides a consistent vocabulary for styling test output. Use semantic
names (`success`, `failure`) rather than colors (`green`, `red`) to
support different terminal themes and accessibility needs.

tags.doc:
Custom theme
```ts
const myTheme: Theme = {
  success: (t) => chalk.green(t),
  failure: (t) => chalk.red.bold(t),
  skip: (t) => chalk.yellow(t),
  dim: (t) => chalk.gray(t),
  title: (t) => chalk.bold(t),
  info: (t) => chalk.cyan(t),
  warning: (t) => chalk.yellow(t)
};
```
{@linkcode defaultTheme} for the built-in colored theme
{@linkcode noColorTheme} for the plain text theme

jsDoc.doc:
Configuration options for reporter initialization.

Controls output destination, coloring, and styling for test reporters.

Minimum log level for output.

- `"fatal"`: Only critical failures
- `"warning"`: Warnings and errors (default)
- `"info"`: Informational messages and above
- `"debug"`: All messages including debug

Disable colored output.

When `true`, uses plain text without ANSI color codes.
Useful for CI environments or piping to files.

tags.value:
@remarks
The reporter itself does not check the `NO_COLOR` environment variable.
The CLI handles `NO_COLOR` via `Deno.noColor` and passes it as this option.
If using reporters directly, you can check `Deno.noColor` yourself.

jsDoc.doc:
Reporter interface for observing and reporting test execution.

Implement this interface to create custom reporters. All methods are
optional - implement only the hooks you need. Methods can be sync or async.

Built-in reporters:
- {@linkcode ListReporter} - Detailed hierarchical output
- {@linkcode DotReporter} - Compact dot notation
- {@linkcode TAPReporter} - TAP format for CI integration
- {@linkcode JSONReporter} - Machine-readable JSON
Called when the test run starts, before any scenarios execute.

tags.name: scenarios
tags.doc: - All scenarios that will be executed

jsDoc.doc: Called when a scenario begins execution.

tags.name: scenario
tags.doc: - The scenario definition about to run

tags.name: scenario
tags.doc: - The scenario containing the step (for parallel-safe reporting)

tags.name: scenario
tags.doc: - The scenario containing the step (for parallel-safe reporting)

tags.name: scenario
tags.doc: - The scenario containing the step (for parallel-safe reporting)

jsDoc.doc:
Immutable definition of a named resource.

Resource definitions contain everything needed to create and identify
a resource: its name, factory function, and source location.

tags.name: Previous
tags.doc: - Type of the previous step's result

tags.name: Resources
tags.doc: - Previously registered resources available to this factory

jsDoc.doc: Unique resource name (used as key in `ctx.resources`)
Factory function that creates the resource
Source location where the resource was defined

Summary of all scenario executions in a test run.

Provides aggregate statistics and detailed results for the entire run.
Passed to {@linkcode Reporter.onRunEnd} after all scenarios complete.
Total number of scenarios in the run
Number of scenarios that were skipped

Complete, immutable definition of a scenario.

This is the core type produced by the builder and consumed by the runner.
It contains everything needed to execute a scenario: its name, options,
and ordered sequence of entries (steps, resources, setups).

tags.value:
@remarks
Scenario definitions are:
- **Immutable**: The entries array is frozen after creation
- **Self-contained**: All options have defaults applied
- **Portable**: Can be serialized (minus functions) for tooling

jsDoc.doc: Human-readable scenario name (displayed in reports and CLI)
Scenario configuration with all defaults applied
Ordered sequence of entries (resources → setups → steps)
Source location where the scenario was defined

Result from executing a complete scenario.

Contains the overall scenario status, timing, all step results,
and any error or skip reason. Passed to reporters and included
in the final {@linkcode RunSummary}.
Total execution time in milliseconds (including setup/teardown)
Error if failed during resource/setup/teardown (not step errors)
Reason for skipping (only if status is "skipped")

Immutable definition of a setup hook.

Setup definitions contain the setup function and its source location.
Unlike steps, setups don't have names or configurable options.

tags.name: Previous
tags.doc: - Type of the previous step's result

jsDoc.doc: Setup function to execute (may return cleanup handler)
Source location where the setup was defined

Immutable definition of a scenario step.

Contains all information needed to execute a single step:
the step function, its options, and debugging metadata.

tags.name: T
tags.doc: - Type of this step's return value

tags.name: Previous
tags.doc: - Type of the previous step's result

jsDoc.doc: Step execution options (timeout, retry) with defaults applied
Source location where the step was defined (for error messages)

Result from executing a single step.

Contains the step's execution status, timing, and either the return
value (on success) or error (on failure). Used by reporters to display
step-level results.
Return value from step function (only if status is "passed")
Error that caused failure (only if status is "failed")
